titleStmt.title: TO The Honor of him, to whom the Noble Fraternitie of Grocers, his Worthy Bro∣thers, haue Dedicated their Loues, in costly Triumphs; the Right Honorable, PETER PROBY, Lord Maur of this Renowned City.
titleStmt.author: Middleton, Thomas

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO The Honor of him, to whom the Noble Fraternitie of Grocers, his Worthy Bro∣thers, haue Dedicated their Loues, in costly Triumphs; the Right Honorable, PETER PROBY, Lord Maur of this Renowned City.
analytic.author: Middleton, Thomas

monogr.title: The triumphs of honor and vertue : A noble solemnitie, performed through the City, at the sole cost and charges of the honorable Fraternitie of Grocers, at the confirmation and establishment of their most worthy brother, the Right Honorable Peter Proby, in the high office of his Maiesties Lieutenant, Lord Maior and Chancellor of the famous City of London. Taking beginning at his Lordships going, and perfecting it selfe after his returne from receiuing the oath of maioralty at Westminster, on the morrow after Simon and Iudes Day, being the 29. of October, 1622. By Tho. Middleton Gent
monogr.author: Middleton, Thomas

div.head: TO The Honor of him, to whom the Noble Fraternitie of Grocers, his Worthy Brothers, haue Dedicated their Loues, in costly Triumphs; the Right Honorable, PETER PROBY, Lord Maur of this Renowned City.
div.l: TO be His Seruant, that hath seru'd
So Worthily of Both; the Same

closer.signed: At your Lordships Command: Tho. Middleton.
